thread.title: Airline passenger chugs bottle of cognac at security gate
thread.title_full: Airline passenger chugs bottle of cognac at security gate

title: Airline passenger chugs bottle of cognac at security gate
text:
Airline passenger chugs bottle of cognac at security gate Woman then deemed 'too drunk to fly' POSTED: 11:42 AM CDT Aug 27, 2015 UPDATED: 11:42 AM CDT Aug 27, 2015 Tweet Paul Courson/CNN 
An air traveler in China chugged an entire bottle of pricey cognac before attempting to board her flight in Beijing because security wouldn't allow the bottle of booze on board. Related Content Stumbling boy punches hole through $1.5M painting 
Fox News reports that the woman was stopped at Beijing Capital International Airport trying to bring the $200 bottle of Remy Martin XO Excellence onto her domestic flight to Wenzhou, China. 
Similar regulations for carry-on liquids also apply in China, so instead of throwing out the liquor or getting out of line, the woman, who was only identified by her last name Zhao, chugged the entire bottle at the gate, the Fox News story said. 
Zhao was then unable to board because she was deemed "too drunk to fly" by gate agents after she reportedly began rolling on the floor and screaming. 
She was taken to a room to rest and awoke several hours later, the Fox report said. Distributed by LAKANA.
